Class Time

java.lang.Object
  Time
public class Time
extends java.lang.Object

Handles time in the format hour:minute. If an attempt is made to set hour or minute outside appropriate range of 0 - 59, component is set to 0

Version:
22/11/04
Author:
A.A.Marczyk

Constructor Summary
Time()
          Creates a time with hour and minute set to 0
Time(int h, int m)
          Creates a time with hour and minute set to parameter values.

          Returns a String representation of time in the format 13:25.
 int getElapsedTime(Time that)
          Returns the time elapsed in minutes between the object and the time given in the parameter

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Time

public Time()
Creates a time with hour and minute set to 0

Time

public Time(int h,
            int m)
Creates a time with hour and minute set to parameter values. If values are not in the range 0 - 59 the component is set to 0 Example: new Time(13,80) would result in a time of 13:00

Method Detail

getAsString

public java.lang.String getAsString()
Returns a String representation of time in the format 13:25. Leading zeroes are included e.g 04:15, 00:35; 14:07

getElapsedTime

public int getElapsedTime(Time that)
Returns the time elapsed in minutes between the object and the time given in the parameter

Parameters:
that - is represents the time used for comparison
Returns:
gives the minutes elasped between the two times

setTime

public void setTime(int h,
                    int m)
Sets the time with hour and minute set from parameter values. If values are not in the range 0 - 59 the component is set to 0 Example: x.setTime(13,80) would result in a time of 13:00
